intro: Microchilus meridanus, commonly known as the Mediterranean microchilus, is a small flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-shaped inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are small, white to pale yellow, and bloom in late spring to early summer. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
